page.title: 02 The Origins of Downpatrick
page.content: Few towns in Ireland can lay claim to such an impressive history as Downpatrick. Ptolemy,in his list of the towns of Ireland about the year A.D.130 includes it as "Dunum". About the beginning of the Christian era the district was ruled by "Celtair",who gave his name to the area.Rath-Celtair-Mhic Duach or Dun Celtair (the fort of Celtar) was its earliest name. "Rath Celtair" was superseded by its ecclesiastical name: Dun-leth-glas (the fortress of the twin green slopes). This name gave place to the shorter form of Dun or Down,and from the 13th century from its connection with the patron saint of Ireland __ Patrick __ hence Downpatrick. Mrs Burns,Irish Teacher.
